content:
### EXISTING STRUCTURES
### Iron Ore Mine at position(x=-17.0, y=-50.0)
Consists of following entities
-  Burner mining drill (position x=-17.0, y=-50.0) 
-  Burner mining drill (position x=-15.0, y=-50.0)
-  Transport belt group (position x=-17.5 to x=-12.5, y=-51.5) that connects the mining drills

### Iron Plate Factory at position(x=-10.0, y=-49.0)
Consists of following entities
-  Furnace (position x=-10.0, y=-49.0)
-  Burner inserter (position x=-13.5, y=-50.5) that puts iron ore into the furnace
-  Burner inserter (position x=-13.5, y=-48.5) that takes iron plate from the furnace
-  Transport belt group (position x=-12.5 to x=-12.5, y=-46.5 to y=-49.5) that connects the inserter to the factory

### Storage at position(x=-16.5, y=-47.5)
Consists of following entities
-  Wooden chest (position x=-16.5, y=-47.5)
-  Burner inserter (position x=-16.5, y=-46.5) that puts items into the chest

### ERROR TIPS
### Errors when using undefined functions
-  Make sure to use the correct function name, for example, use `get_entities` instead of `get_entits`
### Errors when placing entities without a sink
-  Ensure that there is a sink entity in place to accept the output of the entity being placed
### Errors when entities run out of fuel
-  Make sure to provide fuel for entities that require it, such as burner mining drills and furnaces
### Errors when inserters are waiting for source items
-  Ensure that the inserter has a source of items to pick up, such as a chest or a belt

### NAMESPACE
*   Important variables:
    *   `wooden-chest`: Inventory item
    *   `transport-belt`: Inventory item
    *   `burner-mining-drill`: Inventory item
    *   `stone-furnace`: Inventory item
    *   `iron-ore`: Inventory item
    *   `iron-plate`: Inventory item
*   Utility functions:
    *   `get_entities`: Retrieves entities at a given position
    *   `get_entity`: Retrieves a single entity at a given position
    *   `connect_entities`: Connects two entities together
